conversion_verification.notes: The 3D render clearly shows visible wall height and thickness, a perceptible interior volume, an angled isometric view, and the roof or ceiling is removed to expose the interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls have height and thickness (5/5). Floors are clearly separate from walls (3/3). Interior volume is clearly perceivable (4/4). Proper 3D wall corner geometry (3/3). Angled view (5/5). Interior visible from elevated perspective (3/3). Minimal severe perspective distortion (2/2). Roof/ceiling cleanly removed (5/5). Interior spaces fully visible (3/3). Clean geometry without broken sections (2/2).

geometric_accuracy.notes: Correct number of rooms (3/3). Correct adjacency relationships (4/4). Relative room proportions preserved (3/3). Major room identities match (2/2). Major wall positions align (5/5). Wall lengths proportional (3/3). Internal partitions correctly placed (2/2). Doors present and on correct walls (4/4). Windows present but not all on correct walls (e.g., Bedroom 1, Balcony next to Bedroom 2 seem to have different window placements/sizes or are missing in 3D versus 2D. Balcony next to Bedroom 3 also has changed balcony railing/wall) (1/2). Openings proportionally sized and oriented, with some discrepancies for windows/balcony (1/2).

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (4/4). Kitchen elements present (2/2). Bathroom fixtures present (2/2). Furniture placed in correct rooms (3/3). Furniture scale reasonable relative to room (2/2). Orientation logical relative to layout (1/2, some balcony furniture is missing or changed).

visual_clarity.notes: Walls, floors, openings clearly distinguishable (4/4). Geometry readable and not visually confusing (4/4). Interior clearly visible (3/3). Lighting does not obscure geometry (3/3). Consistent material usage (2/2). No major rendering artifacts (2/2). Clean background / presentation (1/2, background is clean but does not add to the scene).

detected_errors.description: Minor discrepancies in window placement/sizing and balcony railing/wall design compared to the 2D plan, especially in Bedroom 1 and Balcony areas.
Some balcony furniture is missing or changed compared to the 2D plan.

summary: The 3D render is an excellent and largely faithful transformation of the 2D floor plan into a geometrically sound isometric cutaway model, with only minor discrepancies in window details and some exterior furniture.
